channel.title: NYT > World
channel.copyright: Copyright 2016 The New York Times Company

item.title: Turkey’s Erdogan, Seeking a More Powerful Presidency, Cites Hitler’s System
item.description: President Recep Tayip Erdogan did not elaborate after citing Hitler’s Germany as an example of the possibilities for a presidential system in a country like Turkey.
item.dc:creator: CEYLAN YEGINSU

item.title: Tel Aviv Shooting Leaves 2 Dead and 7 Wounded
item.description: The police were searching for a gunman who attacked several businesses in the city center, unleashing mayhem on a packed commercial street.
item.dc:creator: DIAA HADID
item.media:description: Israeli medics treating a victim after an attack by a gunman at a Tel Aviv bar on Friday.

item.title: Taliban Attack Kabul Restaurant, Setting Off Shootout
item.description: The first attack of the new year began with a bomb blast at the restaurant, in a neighborhood where many foreigners live.
item.dc:creator: AHMAD SHAKIB and ROD NORDLAND

item.title: The Saturday Profile: Nostalgia and Surrealism Infuse Works of Chinese Animation Artist
item.description: The films of Zhang Xiaotao try to show what the intense pressure to achieve wealth and success in modern China does to the soul.
item.dc:creator: JANE PERLEZ
item.media:credit: Sim Chi Yin for The New York Times
item.media:description: Zhang Xiaotao in a graffiti-filled tunnel outside his studio in Beijing's 798 arts district.

item.title: Pope Francis Urges Overcoming ‘Indifference’ to Attain Peace
item.description: In his first message of 2016, he said that apathy “creates barriers, suspicions, fears and closure,” and he called on people to open their hearts to the needs of others.
item.dc:creator: ELISABETTA POVOLEDO
item.media:description: Pope Francis at a Mass at St. Peter's Basilica in Vatican City on Friday.

item.title: Munich on High Alert After New Year’s Eve Terrorism Threat
item.description: Officials said they had received a “very concrete tip” about a planned attack, but they reopened two transit hubs that had been evacuated.
item.dc:creator: MELISSA EDDY
item.media:description: Police officers at the central train station in Munich on Friday, a day after the authorities evacuated two transit hubs because of a terrorist threat.

item.title: Dubai Hotel Smolders as Firefighters Tackle Last Gasps of Blaze
item.description: Efforts aimed at “cooling down” the skyscraper continued as smoke billowed from its lower portions over 13 hours after the fire broke out, the government said.
item.dc:creator: HALA DROUBI
item.media:description: Smoke continued to billow from the Address Downtown Hotel in Dubai, United Arab Emirates, on Friday.

item.title: Kim Jong-un Talks of Reconciliation in New Year’s Speech
item.description: The North Korean leader’s New Year’s address offered few surprises, suggesting both dialogue with the South and the development of new means of attack.
item.dc:creator: CHOE SANG-HUN

item.title: Kim Jong-un Talks of Reconciliation, and a More Capable Military
item.description: The North Korean leader’s New Year’s address offered few surprises, suggesting both dialogue with the South and the development of new means of attack.
item.dc:creator: CHOE SANG-HUN

item.title: China’s Homeless Find Shelter Under McDonald’s Golden Arches
item.description: In major cities across East Asia, downtrodden people with no better place to sleep have made 24-hour McDonald’s restaurants their overnight home.
item.dc:creator: JAVIER C. HERNÁNDEZ
item.media:credit: Lam Yik Fei for The New York Times
item.media:description: A woman sleeping at a McDonald’s restaurant in Hong Kong in October. Across East Asia, 24-hour McDonald's have become a sanctuary for the downtrodden, providing a warm, dry place to sleep.

item.title: World Briefing: South Africa: A King Goes to Prison
item.description: The king of the AbaThembu clan has started a 12-year sentence for arson, kidnapping and assault, local news media reported on Thursday.
item.dc:creator: REUTERS

item.title: World Briefing: Rwanda: President Paul Kagame Says He’ll Run Again
item.description: Mr. Kagame announced his intention to seek a third term in 2017, confirming a decision that was widely expected after the approval of constitutional changes.
item.dc:creator: REUTERS

item.title: World Briefing: Yemen: Assailants Kill a Militia Leader
item.description: The leader and five of his companions were killed in a drive-by shooting just hours after he had handed over control of a strategic port to government troops.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: Monitoring of Terrorism Threats Has Risen, Official Says
item.description: As the new year approached on Thursday, the police in Munich evacuated two train stations and warned residents to avoid large groups, citing “concrete hints” about a possible attack.
item.dc:creator: ERIC SCHMITT and MELISSA EDDY

item.title: Iran Denounces U.S. Sanctions Over Missiles, Saying It Will Build More
item.description: President Hassan Rouhani, responding to American plans for new sanctions over Iran’s tests of missiles, told his Defense Ministry to build more of them.
item.dc:creator: RICK GLADSTONE
item.media:description: President Hassan Rouhani of Iran, responding to the threat of new sanctions over tests of missiles, reportedly ordered his Defense Ministry to build more of them.

item.title: A Roller Coaster Year Ends With U.S. Markets Mostly Down
item.description: A three-year rally was followed by a lackluster performance in 2015 but, given the year’s headwinds, it could have been worse.
item.dc:creator: PETER EAVIS
item.media:description: Some traders on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange celebrated the last trading day of 2015.

item.title: Hostage at Bataclan Recalls Terrorists During Paris Attack
item.description: A 23-year-old photographer from Chile described the strange chuckle of one of the terrorists as he continued to fire into the crowd.
item.dc:creator: ADAM NOSSITER
item.media:description: People were evacuated from the Bataclan in Paris on Nov. 13 as three gunman held hostages inside.

item.title: Georgia Lawmakers Approve a New Prime Minister
item.description: Lawmakers in Georgia, a former Soviet republic, voted late Tuesday to approve Giorgi Kvirikashvili as prime minister amid popular dissatisfaction with the government.
item.dc:creator: IVAN NECHEPURENKO
item.media:credit: Beso Gulashvili/Presidential Press Service, via Associated Press
item.media:description: Giorgi Kvirikashvili, the newly appointed prime minister of Georgia, attended a cabinet meeting Wednesday in the capital, Tbilisi.

item.title: Open Source: Merkel Urges Germans to See Migrants as ‘an Opportunity,’ Not a Threat
item.description: Chancellor Angela Merkel dedicated a New Year’s Eve address to what she said her nation could gain from the refugee crisis.
item.category: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
item.dc:creator: ROBERT MACKEY
item.media:description: Germany’s state broadcaster added Arabic subtitles to an online copy of Chancellor Angela Merkel’s New Year’s Eve speech.

item.title: Response to Paris Attacks Points to Weaknesses in French Police Structure
item.description: Accounts from survivors, officials and experts reveal that the terrorists operated for substantial periods with little hindrance, and that France’s top-heavy chain of command contributed to delays.
item.dc:creator: ADAM NOSSITER
